page.title: 05Margam Park. NewPond
page.content: NewPond to the east of Margam castle was constructed in 1926, and due to silting was dredged in the winter of 1984-5. It is surrounded by a variety of habitats, coniferous woodland, meadow, wet molinia grassland and stands of bracken. The lake margins are fringed with sweet and yellow flag, greater and lesser reedmace, bur reed and common reed. The main aquatic plants being water milfoil and Canadian pondweed. Quickly recolonised, numerous mayflies testify to its unpolluted waters. Resident wildfowl are: mute swans, coot, mallard moorhen, little grebe and Canada geese. During winter other common visitors are tufted duck, pochard, wigeon and gadwall.
